title: Future Fund posts 11pc return
text:
The Australian government's $166 billion sovereign wealth fund continued its stellar investment performance, delivering an annual return of 11.3 per cent in the 12 months to September 30.

But the Future Fund's chairman Peter Costello warned in its quarterly portfolio update about a tougher earnings environment ahead due to challenges in the global economy.

Future Fund chairman Peter Costello presided over another period of strong returns. Eamon Gallagher

The fund, founded in 2006 by then-treasurer Peter Costello to strengthen the Commonwealth’s long-term financial position, earned a 10 per cent annual return over 10 years, easily exceeding its benchmark target of 6.5 per cent a year.

Returns were up 1.9 per cent over the September quarter.

Future Fund chief executive David Neal said on Monday the fund's strong "risk-adjusted" long-term returns were predicated on diversification to help manage risk and flexibility to adjust the portfolio as the investment environment changes.
description: The Future Fund's chairman Peter Costello warned in its quarterly portfolio update about a tougher earnings environment ahead due to challenges in the global economy.
